intro: Sisymbrium griffithianum, commonly known as the Griffith's tansy, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lobed and have a slightly hairy texture, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium griffithianum is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
